intro: Bremeria punctata, commonly known as the spotted bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or meadow habitats. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture. Bremeria punctata is native to parts of North America and is often found in shaded to partially shaded environments.
